Reviews.Title: “Beach Plaza Hotel, Ocean City, Maryland”
Reviews.Author: Jim O
Reviews.Content: Funky older hotel right on the boardwalk has a porch with with lots of rocking chairs - very comfy place to watch the world go by or catch a sunrise. Lobby reminds me of a 40/50s night club with sofas, chandeliers, stained glass windows, grand piano and a small bar. Staff is friendly and efficient. Rooms are in need of some upgrades and need more table space in room and counter space in bathroom. TV had full cable service. Two chairs in the so-called "seating area" were small and uncomfortable. All in all, a good place to stay. The porch and rocking chairs were the best. Adolfo's restaurant is on site with porch seating, a great menu and fun and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Option!”
Reviews.Author: TaraandBrook
Reviews.Content: We read all of the reviews before booking and finally chose the Beach Plaza based on the "character" we thought it had. First of all, you have to remember that this is a beach hotel - basically, it is what it is. That said, we were quite pleased with our choice! The hotel is older but very nice! The rooms are on the small side but very clean and well-maintained. The staff was awesome to deal with. The ladies who provided maid service were extremely accommodating and do a great job! The rocking chairs on the front porch are awesome also - we ended a few evenings up there. Bathrooms are dated but water pressure in shower was terrific. Only complaint we had there was they could stand to upgrade with the newer curved shower rods. Sheets and towels were higher quality than I expected and that was a nice treat! All in all, a great place to stay and one we would recommend!! We'll look here again when we return to OC!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was great; we recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: We just got back Sunday 9/2/12; stayed 4 nights. Before going, we read some of the reviews and were initially worried, but our stay was nothing like the bad reviews; we loved it. We had two rooms, one in the hotel itself, one in the courtyard; will definitely stay here again. Great location; great Italian restaurant-Adolfo's; beautiful hotel lobby especially at night -- cocktail hour/piano; porch overlooking ocean. Our rooms were clean and nothing was amiss. Doug the manager was very helpful, and check-in staff were great as well; they provided wheel chair for my mother; very accommodating. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: micks79
Reviews.Content: We reserved 3 rooms back in March this year for the Labor Day Weekend! We stay here every year but this year was awful. They lost the reservations for my Daughter and her family and they had to stay in our room for two of the three nights. Then at Checkout they said she had been a "No Show" so they gave it away. She was in room for the first night but had to move out the next morning. Worse part of all was the attitude of the staff on check out "no apologies" for the mix up as they said we were responsible for the mix up! Duh - not sure how we did it! Planning to go some where else next year!

Reviews.Title: “Most Friendly,Professional Staff I Have EVER Dealt With!”
Reviews.Author: Melody_L776
Reviews.Content: From Cheri in reservations,to Doug the general manager,to Jane and Debbie at the front desk,I have never had a more pleasant experience in a hotel in my life! In a day and age where customer service seems to have disappeared,these people have renewed my faith that there are places that still care about their guests.I was overwhelmed by their kindness and dedication to making sure we had the most enjoyable stay possible.It was a true vacation in every sense of the word! I will gladly stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: This is the second year in a row that we stayed here. It is right on the board walk, but not in the heart of all the hustle and bustle. We LOVE sitting on the rockers at night with a cocktail. The ice cream shop below is perfect also. The rooms are a little dated, but always clean. The front desk ladies are ALWAYS smiling and happy!!! They are definitely an asset to the stay! For the money this is a great hotel. We will be staying here again next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Older but quaint”
Reviews.Author: Tracey T
Reviews.Content: After reading recent reviews I was concerned about the reservations I had made here. Yes it is an older hotel. But it has a great location on the boards, We had an oceanfront room in the hotel, which was updated. It was clean, beds were ok to sleep on, I prefer pillowtop, but they weren't overly firm that you woke up with a bad back. Nice to sit out on the porch in the rockers with a drink from the bar and watch the surf roll in. Reasonable price compared to other hotels on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “How quaint!”
Reviews.Author: Jaaycie
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying, wow does this place have style!! The porch has rocking chairs facing straight at the Atlantic ocean. The lobby is immaculately clean and has just about the most fascinating decor I have ever seen. It brings me back in time with its old antique-esque style and eveything goes so well together! The staff is wonderful!!! There is this friendly, down to earth lady that helps to clean to room who is so funny, spunky and lovely! Bedroom: it reminded me of a bed and breakfast! The bed was so comfy, the room cozy and there was even a flat screen tv. The location is perfect!!!!!!! Walking distance to the best part of the boardwalk!!! This place succeeded my expectations. I am so coming back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “location is good”
Reviews.Author: diana d
Reviews.Content: husband and i stayed here, and the room is outdated and could use some cleaning, and fixing. other then this, it was ok, but small. but the view of the ocean was great. its right on the boardwalk.the front desk girl alison was very nice and the secuity guy was really super. we would stay here again,as it is a room and it suited our purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Cancellation Courtesy”
Reviews.Author: wkmiller
Reviews.Content: I'd just like to say that although I didn't stay at the hotel because of an issue with the booking agency I cnacelled. But was impressed how quickly my deposit was refunded and that a written leeter was mailed that showed the deposit was returned. With such courtesy service to a customer who didn't stay, I would think one that does stay would be pleased with the hotel staff when staying at the hotel. After my expierence with using an online booking agency I think going forward I will use them as a reference but Call the Hotel directly to negoiate the rate offered online as using a " middle man" becomes a real headache when you are misled on the price by them changing the date on you when you book. Sorry I can't name the booking agency as still in negotiation.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you just need a place to sleep and want to walk off the porch onto the beach. This was our second time staying. I knew what it was and that's all we needed. We had an oceanfront room and it's definitely worth to pay extra to have that window that overlooks the beach. This is not a luxury hotel. There are no amenities to speak of. No fridge, no pool. However great location and decent rates. Staff are fairly nice, rooms are small, some more outdated than others and walls are thin. I think your satisfaction will really depend on what your expectations are.

Reviews.Title: “Only redeeming quality is the location”
Reviews.Author: jeffm9979
Reviews.Content: Location was solid. Not too far from the "hot spots" but far enough away to have some space/quiet Everything else was bad, if not worse than bad. Lobby was outdated/musty/dirty. Floors in room were uneven, covered by old and worn carpet. VERY small bathroom, shower had loads of mildew/mold in every crack. Wallpaper had significant peeling in multiple spots. Walls were THIN, we had a X07 room, which shared a wall with the stairs. The noise from the stairs was VERY prominent. Also heard neighbors, and hall noise very clearly. Would not recommend at any price. Wish a refund was coming our way, doubtfu;

Reviews.Title: “Would not return !!”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: After spending a day on the beach you would like to return to a COOL room. The air conditioner was warmer than a swamp cooler. We told the staff about the problem and was told someone would look at it. The only change we noticed was the thermostat was turned up when we returned. We endured it for another day and called to the front desk, and was told maintenance. would come to look at it,they did not show up and we had to block our door open because the air coming in from the hallway was much cooler. When checking out we were told we should have asked for a portable fan(really) none was offered to us. Complicating the issue there is no fan in the bathroom for ventilation so if you shower the humid air comes back into your room adding to your discomfort. I was offered no compensation at checkout only,"We've had a lot of complaints about that" "Sorry".

Reviews.Title: “Beach Getaway”
Reviews.Author: beachgal314
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Beach Plaza for a vacation. Check in was very efficient, Randy was very pleasant and friendly. Our room was clean, with plenty of linens. There were a few ants in the bathroom, but nothing major. It was handled to our satisfaction. As for location, can't beat it. The front porch with rockers is always a great spot! The hotel was totally booked, but noise was not a problem. (No noisy teens!) Will definitely stay again! Can't beat price...as long as there is a clean room, safe environment, and good location, that's all I need!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Julia W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Plaza's 3 bedroom apartment. It was half a block from the boardwalk, and super convenient. Once in the unit, we walked into a spacious living/dining room with a pull out sofa, tv, dining table, and two wing chairs. The galley kitchen was stocked with dishes, utensils, paper towels, dish soap, pots/pans, etc. The bathroom had plenty of towels to accomodate our group, but Maggie graciously provided us with more. This place is definitely old and furnished with dated pieces, but the place suited our needs perfectly. We liked that there were two separate entrances, making it easy for someone to knock on the backdoor in case they couldn't get into the apt complex. We weren't expecting a deck off the unit, so that was a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “OC Beach vacation”
Reviews.Author: pghkim
Reviews.Content: Last week is the first time we have stayed here over our 25 years, as our teens wanted to be close to the boardwalk. It was such a neat hotel with old fashion features. The huge porch with rocking chairs was great, we spent a lot of time there after the beach. It's perfectly located in the middle of the boardwalk, close to a lot of shops and restaurants. They have free Wi Fi which was great! We stayed in 301 which has a great oceanview. Granted since it is older there could be some updating of wallpaper and pictures(we all got a laugh out of the parrots in our pictures) but in general very clean with a great staff. We would stay here again especially if you spend your day on the beach and a few hours in your room. Bring your cooler as there is no refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Good value overall”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in mid-july and it was fairly nice. We had a 2nd floor room on the "south" side, so we weren't facing the boardwalk directly. However we were across the hall from the maid's room and ice machine. PROS people were nice room was good size for 2 people room was clean and smelled good comfy bed with A LOT of pillows new carpet great (better than my home) water pressure funny pictures on wall (although our pictures were a bit weird) free parking the rocking chairs on the deck convenience store and restaurant in hotel CONS thin walls (the ceiling in particular was bad since we had a 2nd floor room - we heard the people above us puking) the ice machine and the maids were very loud; on our last morning i heard them vacuuming at 7:30am no pool, no fridge, no balcony, no fitness center trash can in room was extremely small, we ended up asking for a large trash bag Overall it was a good value. If you're a good sleeper id recommend it, or just get a 3rd floor room away from the ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon R
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this place to anyone. Our room was very clean...You could smell clean as soon as you walked in. It was a wonderful atmosphere. The staff went above and beyond to help.Awesome location on the boardwalk.We were sitting in the rockers on the porch and Bill (a staff member) brought us a bucket of ice for our drinks.I will stay here next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great place!”
Reviews.Author: aweiss330
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend in the Beach Plaza hotel from July 16-20th. What a wonderful time we had! Before I wrote this review, I wanted to call the hotel and find out about the beds there. We stayed in room 212, the bed was SO comfortable, we both fell asleep within minutes! Our room was side ocean view, so we looked onto the ocean. Nice view. Bathroom was clean, room was clean (don't really care enough to comment on the decor, because who ACTUALLY cares??) Maid service was great. They continuously reminded us about being able to help out if need be, regardless what time of day. The rocking chairs and awning in the front of the hotel were a wonderful place to relax and hang out and watch the waves and the sun (and the people!) The restaurant within the hotel was Adolfo's, TRY THE EGGPLANT PARM!! It was incredible (as was their marinara sauce!) It's not a Ritz-Carlton hotel, so don't look for those amenities when booking, especially with the price. It did provide a great quality stay at a great value! For a beach vacation and what you need the room/bathroom for, it did a fantastic 5 star job in my eyes!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & good price!”
Reviews.Author: cgibson81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Beach Plaza Hotel, for a family trip. The hotel staff was very polite & helpful, even at midnight when TP was needed! The condos are spacious & clean, loved the bedroom sizes. The maids were very nice & made us feel right at home, no request was a problem! Loved the location, right off of the boardwalk!! Already planning next year's family trip!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Michael S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were unsure about this place at first; it is older and we hoped not run-down like some other older hotels in OC. But we were pleasantly surprised! We stayed for two days after the July 4th holiday. Yes, it is an older hotel, but with the exception of the elevator you really couldn't tell. Our room (114) was clean and neat. We had a great view of the ocean from the large window. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby was reminiscint of the older days with the sofas and decorations, and had plush carpeting that I was a little nervous about walking on with my sandy feet from the beach. It was great sitting in the rocking chairs and watching people walk by, or just enjoying the sights and sounds of the surf. We will definitely stay here again; it was a great bargain at the price we paid! Our only complaint was the thin walls - we could hear those in the adjoining rooms talking, and I figure they could hear us also. No complaints otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “If nothing else it's close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: cadman_foster
Reviews.Content: First I have to say we stayed in the efficiency style rooms that are next door to the main hotel. I have heard that the main hotel is much nicer. Check in was very simple and they hotel has a good sized parking lot with attendants which made parking very easy. The room is a pretty decent size and had two full beds. The mattresses were pretty old and lumpy and they both had big sink holes in the middle of them. So my son had a good time sitting on the edge and rolling to the middle of the bed. The room was clean but there was a lot of rust in the bathroom and on the top of the fridge. The bathroom and kitchen were good sized but horribly out of date. Early 60s style at best we had a hard time just figuring out how to turn on the hot water for showers. On the upside it’s right on the board walk. You literally walk out of your room onto the boardwalk and beach. The highlight of the trip was the main hotels porch. That overlooks the boardwalk. We spent about an hour relaxing in one of the many rocking chairs and people watching. All in all it’s an OK place to stay. You pay a premium price to stay right on the beach and you don’t get much else. But hey how much time do you spend in a room on a beach vacation anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ColleenC2
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my Finceé! We loved everything about our vist!! Our room was really clean, and our view was really pretty. We had a problem with the closet. We told our maid about it, and she had it fixed for us. The people that worked there was very nice and helpful with whatever we needed and questions we had! We also had the best maid her name was Grace. She was so sweet and if we had a problem with anything she would get it fixed for us right away. They do need to make a smoking section on the porch or have more seats out there but other then that we had a blast. We will definetly come back to this hotel. I would recomend the hotel to friends if they are planning on staying in Oc!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in June and it was just absolutely wonderful. The front desk employees were so curteous and nice. The view was beautiful and it was so lovely to sit out on the hotel porch as the sun set. I love that they're right on the boardwalk and have a bar and restraunt right in the hotel. Everything was perfect for our weekend away and I will definately be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: KendrasTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night and it will probably be our last. Our room was room 207 and it backed up to the hardwood stairs. They were very pretty but....verrrryyyyy noisy! The walls must be paper thin because we heard every footstep. The room is also right next to the ice machine which is really loud too. The room was just ok. The bed was old and not very comfortable. The entire hotel needs a major renovation. I paid $135 for a friday night. I suppose that was ok because it is right on the boardwalk. I was very dissapointed overall. They do have a changing area for when you come off the beach. You can shower and change after you check out. That was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Wedding”
Reviews.Author: NewMrsT61612
Reviews.Content: We got married 6/16 & we stayed here. Everything was perfect & we were given an excellent room rate for our wedding guests. Everyone was super nice & friendly, & did everything they could to give us an excellent stay. Cherie & her staff were amazing & we will definitely stay again! If you want to get married on the beach, book your rooms at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Going back”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwoods
Reviews.Content: Spent several days at the Beach Plaza in summer of 2011. Definitely plan on going back. Perfect location, pleasant place. In 2011 they were doing some updates which will make it near perfect this summer.

Reviews.Title: “never staying here again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sam w
Reviews.Content: Absolutely horrible experience. To start, the check in was bad because the workers were mean and the lobby looked like the Tower of Terror. The elevator and creepy paintings made it seem like a haunted house. When we got to the room, the smell was repulsive. The room contained large bugs in the bathroom and tiny ants on the walls near the window. I called the front desk about the ants and they didn't do anything about it. The cleaning lady was so rude and unprofessional. Never was our floor vacuumed and beds were never made properly. The TV was always fuzzy, no VCR or DVD player, the screen was also crooked. The wallpaper was peeling off and the pictures in the room were scary. The paper-thin walls allowed us to hear the conversations of the people in the room next to us. The rooms were small and didn't contain a microwave or fridge. It was terrible and they couldn't pay me enough to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic OC”
Reviews.Author: DanaOC21
Reviews.Content: Last weekend was the first time I've ever stayed here in my 30 years coming to OC. It was such a neat hotel with old fashion features. The huge porch with rocking chairs was great, I spent a lot of time there. It's perfectly located in the middle of the boardwalk, close to a lot of shops and restaurants. This is one of the few, older hotels in OC and I hope it stays here for several more years.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Laurany25
Reviews.Content: I loved beach plaza. The lounge is welcoming and really nice. Their restaurant bambora was delicious and staff was warm. Right in the ocean w a great view!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with old charm”
Reviews.Author: Oldcarguy35
Reviews.Content: The Beach Plaza has been around for many years and is in the process of being renovated (in the off season). There is still a lot of the old charm in it's decor and fixtures. It has a great front porch overlooking the boardwalk and the beach. Also, plenty of parking and convenient to the many shops and stores on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible accomodations...Filth, ants, mildew”
Reviews.Author: bob s
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and the hotel clerk was very nice and very helpful.....it all ended as soon as we entered our efficiency apt. The area rugs were filty, there was no silverware as promised, no dishes, few towels and lots of dust everywhere. The shower was full of mildew, possibly mold on every wall. The shower door leaked and water ran all over the bathroom floor. The vanity was rotted and falling apart. The bathroom window blind didn't work. I had to actually flip each slat by hand to get privacy. Every room was full of sand with no broom anywhere to be found. I raised the edges of several area rugs and there were actually piles of sand under each rug....as if the cleaning people swept the sand under the rugs to hide it. Sand was everywhere. The glass dinning room table had tons of food particles in the crevices where the glass meets the edges of the table top. This of course, attracted ants, while we ate. How horrible. I felt as though we were on a country picnic in some farmers field. The door to the furnace / air-conditioning was coated with filfth and layers of dust. I opened the door and was greeted by tons of dust coating the a/c unit/heating unit. It was actually blowing dust. My wife called the office and reported the fact that we didn't have any utensils or enough towels....they did supply these items on a timely basis. If it had not been for the fact that we were hard up for a place to stay on such short notice we would have raised holy h-ll with the management. Such a deplorable hotel. Fillth, ants, dust, mildew....unbelievable scene. I will never stay near this place again and certainly don't recommend it to anyone. As mentioned previously, we stayed in the efficiency apt. facing Baltimore Ave. The boardwalk hotel area seemed a little better/cleaner. Fresh hot coffee was available in the lobby....sometimes with muffins! The A/C worked well. Additionally, the microwave was outdated and hardly usable. The kitchen stove had 4 burners....only 2 worked. The toaster was antiquated and didn't accept bagels. Please folks....do your homework before staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a family to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Windra1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two boys and our attendant (the boys are both disabled) to this hotel and we were so glad that we picked this place!!! The room was right off of the boardwalk, and the 3 bedroom apartments were homey, and laid out nice. It is not a new property so don't look for fancy, but it was perfect for us. The price was reasonable and we were able to cook meals and have somewhat of a normal routine for the children. The staff was VERY friendly and even though our trip got cut short due to Irene (we had to evacuate) they were friendly and apologetic for the inconvenience. We will be back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really old and dirty - did not even clean tub”
Reviews.Author: Dn1231
Reviews.Content: This place is really old and when we got into the room there was sand in the tub and standing water. They did not even bother cleaning it. When I called the front desk it took them 2 hours to fix it. That's two hours of our time. So later during the day when I called to check out a little late so we can be compensated for the wasted time they would not let me do it. I asked to speak to manager they said he's not here. It is during a weekend and there's no manager?? When I complained to the front desk she said I didn't need to be there when they fixed. I didn't know if the contractor they hired is going to steal my stuff. Just one word worst place I stayed ever. Stay away!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to beach, room a bit tight”
Reviews.Author: DomGoddess
Reviews.Content: Our grown son picked out this hotel. It was great to be close to the beach, but I prefer queen size beds, and we had doubles. The parlor/lobby/restaurant were lovely. The restaurant menu was a bit unusual and pricey for us, but I would surely have loved to try it if we had stayed longer. The door to our room had about an 1 inch gap under it, and our son didn't close the door correctly and it was really open all night. That and the air were basically the noisest parts of the room. No frig in the hotel either. Low water pressure and peeling wallpaper (could see mildew under it-ugh). They don't clean behind the massive headboard and I could see all kinds of stuff-ugh! Parking was good. Internet service as ok. A good choice for two people, not three.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value, & Kinda Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Dubs2233
Reviews.Content: Pros: First trip to O.C. and loved the location. We enjoyed having a beer on the front porch or going downstairs to Kelly's to eat wings. You can sit on the front porch in a rocking chair and the bartender will take your drink order (slow service, but it was nice at sunset). The two second walk to the beach is awesome. We stayed in one of the apartments so having a kitchen/fridge helped offset some of our food costs since we we were able to bring breakfast and lunch items with us. Tons of shops and eateries close by. Cons: We're not very picky, but I've got to say that our room was on the dirty side. (Grime in the toliet, around the toliet, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BadSatin
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. My mother bf and i go every year and have since i was young. We stay on the efficiency side. The hotel is old and could use some updating but it is good for the price considering how expensive the boardwalk hotels are. The efficiency side is very open and nice to sit on the balcony and watch the sun rise. 13th street is a great place... if you go down you will find all the food and attractions. Up is mostly all hotels. Staff is nice.. they clean the room daily and are happy to change/give you fresh whatever you like. ALWAYS have an issue with the refrigerator. Staff has always been good gotten it fixed and stored our food in the mean time. Manager even comped us a night which was totally unnecessary but very nice. Stay here if you enjoy value and being able to cook your own food. Its a nice place for a beach trip. Not luxury but just what you may need.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwoods
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently in an efficiency unit complete with kitchen and very generous closet space. Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and thought the hotel was just as it should be for a beach vacation. Not too fancy and right smack on the beach. Staff very friendly and helpful and restaurant had top-notch cuisine. Bathrooms, however, need updating due presumably to sandy guests clogging up the drains! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Ocean City”
Reviews.Author: Skeetlax
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to OC and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Staff was extremely friendly and very helpful with suggestions on activities. Loved the rocking chairs on the front porch. Rooms need updating, but were clean and functional. We made reservations to return in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location and old fashioned hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: elizfitz1
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, wonderful restaurant fit for foodies, friendly service, excellent bargain rates. The water front boardwalk location with the boardwalk train going by your front door makes up for the old wallpaper and vintage bathrooms. A/C works great, handicapped accessible, parking lot. On site are gourmet restaurant and a casual cafe and a separate piano bar and outdoor dining, both formal and casual, and ice cream shop and 2 gift and sundries shops. Rent beach chairs and umbrellas a few steps from the door.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go past the lobby!!”
Reviews.Author: lapForestHill_MD
Reviews.Content: Phillips Beach Plaza Hotel on the Boardwalk in Ocean City, MD offers a 3 bedroom apartment behind the hotel and just what my family needed for a quick get away vacation. The lobby and restaurant are gorgeous but, don't go past the lobby. The apartment was 60's style old. We were greeted by a friendly front porch. Inside was a nightmare with paneling on the walls, old cat photos, torn lampshades, noisy ceiling fans, rusty bathroom fixtures and a bathroom ceiling and floor that needs to be renovated badly. The pull out sleeper sofa was disgusting with old food and trash thrown underneath and never cleaned. The hotel offers daily maid service, but the only thing the maid service did was replace the used towels. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE.

Reviews.Title: “Old School all the way (just he way I like it)”
Reviews.Author: Jeffsterl
Reviews.Content: This review is for the hotel, not the "apartments." If you are looking for ultra modern latest and greatest fad in styling, don't stay here. This building is old, and I like it. Old school charm, decor, and manners... There are no balconies. Stucco walls and swirled ceiling panels, tiled bathrooms with enough water pressure to power wash a deck. A slow old mirrored elevator with an analog control panel, and actuall keys for the rooms. We stayed during "senior week" where O.C. is invaded by hoardes of what the locals refer to as "June Bugs", high school seniors there for the week, partying and carousing. They didn't stay at the Plaza (mercifully!) The Plaza is clean, the staff helpful and friendly, the porch with the DJ each night was wonderful, sitting back, relaxing, people watching and enjoying the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Ancient, and charming.”
Reviews.Author: oceancityismylove
Reviews.Content: We originally were staying in Assteague, but our site was not ready so we had to rent a hotel for one night, and for cheap. The Visitors center got the room for us for only $91. Although out room didn't have a view, the rooms were nice, and clean. It was not noisy, and the staff was very friendly. The bathrooms are a bit small and old-looking, but the shower had good water pressure. The best part? The rocking chairs on the front porch. My sister and I sat while the kids walked the boardwalk, but even they came up and sat for a while. All in all, nice old place and for a nice price, so we are looking to rent another room for this year, the night before we start camping at Assateague.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location, Welcoming Staff, Great Bar, Really Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: EllKell
Reviews.Content: Since most boardwalk hotels are known for being expensive and dirty, this was a welcome change. The rooms are low-priced, very small, and the bathrooms tiny and old-fashioned, but the hotel itself is great. Free, convenient parking is a rarity on the boardwalk, but here you have it. Yes, most guests are seniors. That, plus the age of the building (built 1920's) and the thick walls makes it quiet and friendly. The staff is very welcoming. My favorite thing is the big front poor with rocking chairs overlooking the boardwalk for peope-watching. We bought drinks from the bar and enjoyed them on the porch. One funny thing happened there: An inebriated older lady on the tram looked up at the rocking chair occupants when it stopped and slurred, "Why don't you take a picher!". The piano bar, with red velvet sofas and luxurious Victorian decor, is charming. The piano player and singer were fantastic. Don't be fooled by the Philip's name. The cafe looks like an upscale restaurant, but is nothing like the Philip's Seafood Restaurant chain. The food is cheap and very bad. Eat at the Brass Balls for breakfast, Fager's Island for dinner. Beware of boardwalk food in general.

Reviews.Title: “This is not the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: duhhxbarbie
Reviews.Content: The Phillips Beach Plaza Hotel is a place for the old-folks. It certainly is not for the young love birds, or high class business men and women. When the receptionist gave us an actual key to get into our room, I knew this place was old fashioned. The lights are dim; there is only one electrical socket; there is tacky wallpapet; the carpet is old, there is NO balconies. The sink water pressure is terrible, yet the shower pressure could blast a hole through your body. There is no fan in the bathroom and the room is stuffy because there is no AC circulation either. The walls are paper-thin! The beds, however, are admirably comfortable. There is no table to sit at, no refrigerator, no microwave, and no seating besides a measly desk chair (but there is no desk!). They did, however, give you a pretty cool complementary pen. All in all, SAVE YOUR $136 a night because this place IS NOT WORTH IT. I would HIGHLY recommend the Dunes Manor Hotel on 22nd St. The hotel staff is very nice though, the parking is good, they have a restaurant in the lobby, and its right on the boardwalk on 13th street. There is NO POOL & NO FITNESS CENTER. There is also a little store under the hotel. Its a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: bnr0914
Reviews.Content: Stopped on way home from obx. It Is very old but a classic. Location was good nice beach out front.

Reviews.Title: “Phillips is fine.”
Reviews.Author: weim99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Phillips Beach Plaza Hotel July 19-21 and had a good time in Ocean City. This was our third time visiting Phillips Hotel and have never experienced any problems during any stay. Being a family on a budget, we like the fact that we can visit OC and stay right on the beach/boardwalk and not pay the crazy prices of other properties. The hotel and rooms are old but they are clean and the staff was friendly. The only ammenity the hotel could use is a pool(for the kids) but then again we are at the ocean. We like the Phillips Beach Plaza Hotel and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “OVERPRICED, ANCIENT, AND FILTHY”
Reviews.Author: millerkljs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my husband and 2 teenage children. Very disappointed to say the least. The location right on the boardwalk was the only positive thing about it (although, it was ground level and the lock on the sliding glass door was stuck so my husband had to fix that and besides the fact that everyone walking on the boardwalk was always peeping in!) Efficiency room was quite ancient and in need of a total makeover. The "equipped" kitchen had very old and dirty utensils and dishes and although we did wash and use the silverware-the sink was disgustingly old (and we had to use it often because the kitchen had limited silverware!) Our floors did not get swept, nor did the bathroom or kitchen get cleaned. We were not given enough towels even when I left a note for housekeeping. The bathtub did not drain well so when you took a shower you stood in 5 inches of dirty, sandy water. The beds were horrible to sleep on and the pillows were flat and lumpy. Would never stay there again! Very overpriced!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: Chriseckstine
Reviews.Content: We visited in summer '10 and had a great time! I will say that the place needs a few updates. Example: our room was cleen, bathroom was spotless, but a few items including the carpet and paint/ walls were well used and seen better days. I can see where it once used to be a well kept place with the traces of brass polish around the tarnished elevator door buttons and the dusty, but beautiful mirrors in the hallway. Over all, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I personally, loved it besides the fact that is was the seniors week when I went so that kind of ruined it.”
Reviews.Author: selenaMarieex3
Reviews.Content: Personally, I loved the hotel. I am a teenager, and I always go with my family and usually two other friends. We loved the fact that it was right on the board walk, and we didn't have to walk far to go shopping! Although, we've been going since I was born, and even farther than that but last year was very unexceptable. We went during the time when seniors come to celebrate, and all we heard was screaming, partying, and people banging and fighting. Luckily, we contacted the front desk and they took care of it. This year, we are going in august to where seniors will no longer be there. I personally thought Phillips was clean, neat, and very efficiant. I would reccomend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “aprtments nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: flarsen852
Reviews.Content: We stayed at an apartment (half block from main hotel last week of September 2009) which was very nice and clean. Good sized with three bedrooms and full kitchen. Service was good. Short walk to boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean front room nice, clean, food in their restauant delicious”
Reviews.Author: Seniorfour
Reviews.Content: Stayed Sept. 14 -17, 2009 with husband and two retirement friends. We had ocean front room. Rooms were nice size, clean and the towels were reoplinished daily. Enjoyed long sits using rockers on their porch. Beautiful ocean front view. Saw dolphins from the porch. The food in the restaurant was delicious, the server was extremely pleasant. Prices were very reasobable.. Would definetly stay here again. Didn't have pool. But younger folks can use the ocean. St. Marys Retirement Four

Reviews.Title: “A crumbling mess.”
Reviews.Author: focuskat
Reviews.Content: Phillips Beach Plaza Hotel is located on the boardwalk. This location was perfect for my family and I. Sadly, the hotel is literally crumbling. We stayed for a week. We picked this hotel because of the location and the price. It was very reasonable. We are on a budget so we could not relocate because of the problems. The beds: Daily I found little pieces of dust and dirt on my white bedsheets. Initially I blamed the kids, reminded them to take off their shoes etc. Finally one night I discovered the dust and dirt was blowing out of the AC unit above the bed. When I looked up the vent was caked in dust, dirt and such. I did not get the feeling that the bedspread was clean. So I removed it and used my own blanket. The bathroom: The water was hot and good water pressure. The tile had some mildew but overall the bathroom and bath linens were clean. More: I kept finding little pieces of white stuff all over the carpet and on the table. It took me 3 days to figure out that the popcorn cieling was actually crumbling and falling. Staff: Debbie and Darlene were my housekeepers. They were angels. Really nice ladies. Under paid! If you do go here, please remember to tip them!

Reviews.Title: “Shame on you, Phillips”
Reviews.Author: party0five
Reviews.Content: As a child, I went to OC with my family every summer for 15 years. The crowning event was when we went to Phillips for dinner. I thought it was the most grand, fancy place I had ever seen. The Phillips I grew up with represented the best of OC, and I am beyond disappointed that it has fallen into such disrepair. At first, I was confused by the disparity in the reviews, but figured out it is a result of the hotel rooms vs the apartments/efficiencies. We did not stay in the hotel, but from the sound of the other reviews, it is probably ok, if a little dated. The apartments, on the other hand, are a nightmare. The reports of filth are not exaggerated. The condition of the fixtures and furniture is worse than anything I've ever seen. I can't believe that the Phillips family allows their name, once so respected and admired, to be associated with a property in such horrible disrepair. I have talked to a lot of people about my experience, and everyone is equally shocked that such an icon in OC has turned into a run-down, neglected rat-trap. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life!”
Reviews.Author: BettyKansasCity
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom apartment for the weekend. We assumed it was somehow connected to the hotel near the boardwalk but knew it was not oceanfront. We were very surprised to find out that is was not even close to the hotel. It was located on Baltimore Street. We went back to the office and they did offer us another room, an efficiancy which is near the hotel. It was cheaper and the management did give us a portion of our money back. We came back in an hour supposedly after they got the room ready. As soon as we walked into the room we were shocked and appalled. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall. Dried caulk had dripped down a mirrored wall. There were cigarette ashes on the floor. We pulled down one of the bedspreads and found dirt in the bed. The blanket in the closet was SO disgusting I wouldn't let a dog sleep on it. The lampshade in the living room was absolutely disgusting. From what we could see from the kitchen it appeared to be mostly clean. There was no way we were staying there. We went back to the office and told them our story. The manager never came out of the back office. The employees had to keep going back to speak to him or her. If a customer has such a terrible problem with the accomodations, shouldn't the manager speak to them? In the end, they did end up giving us all of our money back and we went next door to the Commander and had a wonderful weekend! It was a beautiful hotel and the employees were wonderful! It was cheaper than Phillips with an oceanfront view! I can't even believe that Phillips is not shut down by the health department. I would never, ever recommend one of the apartments at Phillips.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: LM50
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Phillips numerous times over the past 10 years last. Great location, reasonable rates - the only problem is it just looks like no one cares about the place anymore and it is slowly falling into a state of disrepair. Peeling paint, dirty carpet, overflowing trash cans in the bathroom behind the bar area, food stains on the walls of the restaurant, graffiti carved into the elevator doors, stained bed linens,dirty lampshades, and I could go on and on. It never ceases to amaze me that management just turns a blind eye to these things. Do they think no one notices? We sure did and I am sure we aren't the only ones. When will management realize that a hotel may be old but if you keep it clean and maintained patrons will keep coming back. We are sad to say that our most recent visit will be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Unkind”
Reviews.Author: gptaz
Reviews.Content: Been staying in the 13th street area for 30 years. It is a shame that Phillips has taken such a nose dive. It could be a gold mine. Booked and paid for 7 nights. Stayed in apartment. Bugs in bed. Blood on sheets. Shower leaked from apt. above. Batteries kept falling out of smoke detector. I am not a complainer nor am I all that picky, so I was willing to deal with a lot. I did call about the shower leak and the smoke detector. They came but didn't fix either. The restaurant closed at 1PM as we arrived to have a nice lunch on the porch. Because of the location (right on the boardwalk on the first level but far enough away from the commotion closer to the inlet) and the accomodations having a full kitchen, we really were willing to deal with a lot. We checked out on Friday instead of Saturday even though we had paid for the entire week and could have stayed until Saturday. The final straw was when I went to book for the next year....same week......(yes, I was still willing to stay there) they told me they would not allow me to book for 7 days because we checked out a day early and you are not allowed to do that. The fact that we had paid for 7 nights did not matter. I was treated rudely and in a condescending manner by the reservations manager. After much "discussion" I was told that they would "allow me to book for the full 7 nights but that if I 'checked out on Friday again' I would be charged a penalty fee. This summer, we are going to try a new place. It won't be as convenient, so I would have much prefered Phillips but not worth being treated as if I had done something wrong. Phillips had a guest willing to tolerate almost any problem (I know the property is old and I understand that some things just are simply unavoidable) but they lost my business mainly because of my treatment when I tried to rebook.

Reviews.Title: “All my life!”
Reviews.Author: webteach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been going to the Beach Plaza since we were children. Of course we still like it as it has changed little since then (and we are in our 50s). Reading these reviews made me see that others might be shocked by the age and condition of the hotel. To us, it has always been an affordable, friendly place for a weekend getaway. We love the dining room and Britt and Apple. Go with low expectations and you will have a great time. Please see the picture of one of the oceanfront rooms. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hi907
Reviews.Content: We've been coming here for the past thirteen years, and everything has been wonder, the staff, the food service, and the wonderful view of the beach! We will continue coming here for a very long time. We all enjoy phillips because the rooms aren't too small and aren't too big and their prices aren't too cheap or too expensive! The only problem we ran into was with the shower but the staff had fixed it which was very greatful of them and we thank you for that! We also love the boardwalk hotels but we've only been in phillips and that is where we are going to continue going. Phillips is so understanding and everyone is just so nice! I have heard that they have got a new owner and they have re- done the whole place. My family and I are anxious to see what is in store for us this year. Phillips, i hope you all stay in business for along time and we just want to say you are all doing a Fantastic job keep it up! Thank you for a wonderful Vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, HORRIBLE Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: mpmpmp3
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in which i had to endure this hotel. To say this hotel has potential, is an understatement. It is truly a beutiful old hotel with a great restaurant and the staff, at least everyone that I dealt with was truly Aces. I do not blame them for the FILTH that they also endure. First and foremost, let me say that I wish I had used my American Express card to pay for this trip so I could have them not pay them for this stay. However I payed cash, so shame on me. From the moment you walk in, you see what COULD be one of the better hotels to stay in,,,,,,,THEN the smell hits you. Thank god that I went there with my friends and not my family. If I had brought my wife & daughter, I would have had to find another hotel. The Phillips family should be ashamed to put thier names on this hotel. I came home with my luggage and emptied it outside my house in hopes that the filth I saw there, stayed there. Grit and grime covered every surface I could see and feel. The smells that I COULD identify were that of mold and heavy grease. ONly the extremely frugal could call this hotel a bargain or worth the cost. I am a grown man, who has stayed in some very nasty places all over the country over the years and Phillips is right at the top,,,,,or bottom of the list. Heres my challenge to them go buy a Petry Dish and leave it around for a week in one of the bedrooms and see that grows. I'll say it again,,,,,One of the worst experiances I have EVER had PERIOD !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst place ever....”
Reviews.Author: luvmymic
Reviews.Content: We checked in, we had the apartment side of facility because we have a 10 year old and a 5 month old. AFter we carried everything up 2 flights of steps in the heat, we sat and looked at this place. It was horrible. We pulled the sheets back to look and found a bug in the bed. Then as I started putting things in the kitchen away I found another bug. I felt so uncomfortable letting my children sit on the furniture do to the feel of "dirt". It just was horritlbe. I went and spoke to manangement, they were very kind and did give us a complete refund. of course we were 3 hours from home and not knowing where to go we ended up at Park Place which was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: nyboi426
Reviews.Content: I arrived and everything seemed nice. I was told that my package included the breakfast and dinner for my stay--it didn't! i would definately make sure that I get what i paid for. The place is old and needs an update ASAP! Definately not worth it. You could stay at a nicer place. The water doesn't flow well through the tub and the space is reduced so you can't get a nice bath. Really consider staying ELSEWHERE, I MEAN IT!

Reviews.Title: “plenty of room, close to the beach, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ginalisa
Reviews.Content: My fiance and i stayed there for a week. It was clean, and had so much room . living room had seating for a large family, dining room with large table the kitchen has a nice size stove and refigerator with everything you need to cook . One day we went crabing and came home and cooked 30 crabs. The bedroom was comfortable and spacious, the bathroom was smaller but clean , plenty of closet space. You can walk right out to the beach. . We are planning another trip and want to stay here again in may.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! A Complete Dump”
Reviews.Author: MeetmeinSanJuan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Phillip's Beach Plaza hotel in August 2006, and it was just terrible. Usually, we stay at condominiums, but with the location and generally good reveiws, we chose to stay at this hotel. We love Phillip's Seafood Restaurant, the crabs are good and the atmosphere is fun, and this review does not express our opinion of the restaurant. This hotel is a complete pigs-stye. Upon check-in, we went to our parking-lot view room. The hallways stunk of cat urine, and were dark and moist. The room was even worse. The carpet looked so dirty, one had to really think before taking off their own shoes. The rooms were also small and a complete fire-trap. There were no windows or vents in the bathrooms (which I know is required in all hotels), which were far from clean. On our second day at the hotel, the power went out when a circuit blew, causing us to be left in the dark for at least an hour if not longer. During this, the elevator of course stopped, and as employees literally yelled down the shaft to see if people were stuck or not, guests were forced to climb the stairs to their rooms. The price for our room was close to $200 a night, and this was parking-lot room and all. I understand that prices are obscene in all of Ocean City, but for our room, I thought this was way too much. We probably would have and gone to another hotel except for it's location, which was right on the boardwalk and near my brother's condo. Despite this, we will not be returning to the Phillip's Beach Plaza Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Ocean City, MD”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Ocean City, MD. and we loved it! My husband and I alone with our 2 1/2 year old son celebrated our six wedding Anniversary on the beach. The Hotel was easy to find, located directly on the beach. Our room was small but clean and comfortable, and the bathroom was cleaned and restocked with fresh towels everyday. The hotel rates were very reasonable, Everybody was very helpful from the parking attendant to the front desk people, the staff was very friendly and always willing to answer questions. The breakfast buffet was hot and fresh, the waiterss was so funny our 2 1/2 year old loved her! I would recommend you tried the buffet. We also ate breakfast outside on the deck and enjoyed the ocean view. But, like any other piece of prime real estate you must get there early to get a great seat! IF you have to wait for seating to become available you can sit on the porch in the rocking chairs. Just be careful you don't fall asleep. One of the better buffets to try is Ember's located @ 24thst & Coastal Hwy. A great way to work off your meal is to try the one of the two miniature golf courses located directly across the street. For those who have to satify a sweet tooth just take a strool or the tram on the boardwalk for some ice cream go to Dumser's and don't worry about the calories. For the popcorn lover there's Fisher's popcorn also make a quick stop at the Candy Factory. Finally, a great place to wear down the kid and the kid in you try on the south end of the boardwalk to see Ripley's belive it or not and all the surrounding amusement park Named Jolly Roger's. With all this in mind we will definately be returning to Phillip's and Ocean City in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nanaof3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a long weekend at Phillip's Beach Plaza Hotel in OC, MD. If you like street rods or the cars from the 1940's to the 1970's then you have to visit Ocean City, MD for their Cruisin Weekend! It is held in May each year. We have been coming down here for many years for this event. We are always amazed by the number of autos they can pack in one small town for 3 days. This was our first stay at the Phillip's Beach Plaza Hotel on 13th Street and the Boardwalk. I had read some of the reviews and was skeptical about staying there. We were looking for something both reasonably priced yet centrally located. This hotel fit both requirements quite well. We were located in an ajoining building which had the effeciencies and apartments. I didn't remember booking an effeciency but was glad they put us there. It included 2 double beds, a small dining area, a small but full kitchen, and a full bathroom. The full size refrigerator was a plus because we like to keep drinks for the time we spend there. It was not spacious or high class but it was fine for the two of us for a 3 night stay. Yes, it is one of the older hotels and could use some renovating; but it was definetly worth $82.00 a night( tax included ) for an efficiency on the boardwalk! Everyone on the staff there was extremely friendly and helpful, from the maids to the hotel manager( who was filling in as parking attendant till his college help arrived )! The maids did a great job cleaning the room and keeping us supplied with towels. They even had a small basket with beauty aids in the bathroom like the expensive hotels next door. Each day there was a sanitized rubber mat for the tub/shower. I don't think I have ever stayed anywhere that had better water pressure in the shower. It was like getting a water massage! The Phillip's By The Sea Restaurant is exceptional for a quiet dinner for 2. Outstanding seafood dishes in the Phillip's tradition at an average price in Ocean City. I really enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the restaurant. It was reasonably priced, had a good selection, and everything was fresh and hot. Even better we didn't have to walk 10 blocks or get in the car. I would definetly stay here again for a reasonably priced getaway. Just a note! Other restaurants to try in OC are Harrison's Harbor Watch, Phillips Seafood Buffet, Hooper's Crab House, Crab Alley, and Captain's Galley II.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a low budget trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Phillps is great if you are looking to get away for a cheap weekend. If you arent looking for any special accomodations this is perfect. The rooms are not anything special by any means and they could be fixed up a little...but this is Ocean City not Vegas. This is a prime location and the apartments are a steal. If you are looking to go to OC for a luxury vacation dont stay here but if you are just going with a group of friends to go out and have fun this is the perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful getaway on a budget!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely weekend a Phillips. We read the reviews before going and were a wee bit leary of some of the information. We were more than pleasantly surprised and delighted with the experience and the pricing. From the moment you arrive in the large FREE parking area and walk into the lobby any fears will be immediately gone. The staff was friendly and courteous. The motel is older but the room was clean, the bed comfortable, the bathroom sparkled!! The Famous Phillips Seafood was wonderful and UNDERPRICED in my opinion!! The Piano bar and its warm friendly atmosphere offered a wonderful respite after a lovely walk on the cold Atlantic Ocean. We awoke the next morning with the sun rising over the ocean, coffee awaiting us in the lobby, friendly staff exchanging greetings with the guest and a delicious buffet breakfast. Check in and check out was a breeze. Yes, Phillips is an older motel but you are not paying $300.00 a nite for a room either. We go to Ocean City for the beach, the ocean, the boardwalk, the wonderful seafood, and a place to rest our heads. Phillips has all the amenities I need without paying a fortune!!!!!! Would I go there again??? Am I packed yet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Like Grandma's house but worse”
Reviews.Author: Leoned
Reviews.Content: Are you kidding me? The place hasn't been updated in about 200 years. It smelled so bad in my room I thought they a) had the closet filled with moth balls or b) my grandma was hiding under the bed. Sure it cost $50 a day off-season, but it's not even worth that. Not to mention the ice cold shower one morning - ugggh. The breakfast and service in the restaurant were the only redeeming qualities. If you want a nice vacation place go elsewhere. If you like, dirty, old and stale this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back”
Reviews.Author: Debi1
Reviews.Content: We took another trip to Phillips - we stayed in a room facing the parking lot - we couldn't see paying for OF room since there are no balconies to go on - but they have a very nice porch with rocking chairs - we enjoyed our weekend away - we arrived around 11:00 Sat morning - hadn't eaten breakfast yet - checked in then went to the restaurant at the hotel for breakfast - put our things in the room and went on the boardwalk - the room was not bad at all - 4 poster king bed - tv - chair - table - the only thing was the floor was not level - we laughed and said if we went in drunk we would fall into the wall or bathroom - bed was comfortabe - everyone was very nice - the women at check in was very friendly - the waitress in the restaurant is always friendly - she is there working every time we go in - we were leaving to go to dinner one evening and one of the cleaning ladies told us of a nice place to go to dinner - not sure what people have been saying about the staff not friendly - this is not a new upscale hotel - it is a very affordable old hotel with lots of character, my husband and I were joking about our room being haunted, we were leaving one afternoon to go for a walk on the boards and after we turned the tv off and was walking out the door - it turned back on - we had to go back in and turn it off again. I would recommend this for someone who is not looking for a lot of glitz - just want to go and relax - it didn't cost us a small fortune to go for a weekend - I would rather go more often and stay here - than stay at one of the newer more expensive places and not go as often -

Reviews.Title: “It wasn't the newest hotel, but It was pleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the ocean front 1 bedroom apts. It was older but fairly clean. When we arrived the A/C was turned on, it was clean, fresh towels, they filled the ice trays up in the refidgerater, most all the essentials for cooking were clean and there. We have stayed several times in the hotel itself, but after staying in one of the apartments I will never stay in the hotel again because of the privacy it affored us. We go before or after the season because the rates are lower, and phillips offers great deals for a two night, three day stay at the hotel with meals encluded in the price. I found Phillips to be the only place I would want to stay, its friendly, quaint, and comfortable. The people who stay are older as well, which is a plus for Ocean City!..

Reviews.Title: “Dirty yet quaint”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Phillips because we needed at "moderate" efficency unit since we were in OC for a dance competition. On the boardwalk was a plus.We wanted to sit on the porch but never got there. I swear people camped out there. We stayed in an interior unit by the stairs. The lobby was quaint but that was it. The room was old and dirty. The kitchen cramped. I sprayed everything with Lysol. We could tell that the facility was old, there was a mounted beer bottle opener in the kitchenette. The beds were uncomfortable. We payed $195/night. - About $95 too much. They charged us for an extra night. We actually stayed accross the street at the Safari for one night. They wouldn't give us our money. The front desk person called my and told me I was mistaken (-I had the other hotel's bill as proof I stayed there. I complained to American Express. I got my credit but the hotel wouldn't answer their correspondance. A positive-the breakfasts in the restaurant were great...and reasonable. We sat outside to eat All in all I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Missing $70.00”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment/efficiency section of this hotel for only one night at a cost of $210.00 plus tax. The room was outdated but looked clean. Around 2:00 am was awakened by our front door either being opened or closed. Called the Lobby who sent Security. Security responded quickly and suggested that another renter (possibly drunk) made a mistake by trying to enter our unit. In the morning, after eating at the breakfast buffet which was pretty good and reasonably priced, we discovered $70.00 cash missing from a wallet. Immediately complained to the front desk and the police was called. Hotel Manager did refund us 100% for our stay but was out the $70.00 plus our peace of mind. Based on that fact alone, we could not recommend Phillips.

Reviews.Title: “They should pay me to stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Ocean City and while I don't have any type of comparison to make with other hotels in the area, this hotel was one of the worst that I have ever stayed in. We stayed in the Philips building that is apartments and efficiencies so I am not sure what the "hotel" is like. However, the bed had no springs which made it cave in plus there were bed bugs. The furniture was very dated and the floor was dirty. After showering, my feet turned black with dirt just walking to the bed. I expected more for the money. The upside is that it is on the boardwalk and the restaurant was really good. However, if you value a good night sleep and a clean room, I would not suggest staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Tear it down!”
Reviews.Author: LoveLife82
Reviews.Content: Its old and dirty. Definetely needs a extreme renovation. We stayed at the apartments for 300 a night/for three bedrooms. Definetely affordable compared to other over priced hotels ocean city is natorious for. Overal the stay was ok. DIdnt feel clean during the whole trip. Beds are very uncomfortable. Seems as though all the furniture was over twenty years old. THere was sand everywhere, even in the beds. The pull out sofa was broken. Couldnt even give that sucker to salvation army because it was so nasty/ had to put a sheet over it to feel decent about sitting on it. If you're a person who likes to stay away from germs etc., do not stay here. The staff was helpful at times. THe lady at the front desk (check in) was rude and snotty!. We called for more towels and soap on one of the nights, but didnt recieve anything till the next day. But overal housekeeping/room service was considerate and helpful. I would like to say the girl who helped us book the hotel (jen- whom we were told no longer worked there) was extremely helpful and curtious (thats for the management to know-if you read this.) Being on 13st. obviously convienant to everything- right off the boardwalk. Needs renovation- better yet, jut tear the place down. So old and dirty, i dont know how you'll fix the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best part of the Phillips is the front Porch, which everyone seems to find even if they don't stay there , so don't count on using it to much. Our room was not very clean at all, bed was made every day and clean towels was about all cleanning people do. Some staff was very friendly and others were not so. We enjoyed eating breakfast on the front porch, and looking at the ocean. There are no Coffee Pots in rooms they do offer it down stairs in the morning but you have to wait till they put it out. Bring your own Hair Dryers & irons these rooms have nothing. We could open the window but our room had no screens and the showers were another story they went from hot to cold water so you had to be careful. This is not a family place, I would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at this hotel for over 6 years. We used to stay at the old Commander for over 20 years. When they remodeled we needed to find another place to stay so we checked into the Phillips Hotel. We were so happy with the hotel that we now have 5 different family members staying there. We are now up to 5 rooms and try to get them ajoining. We have a blast every year. They are nice and take pride in there place. We will be staying there until they move. Thanks Angie Aull

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in the second week of june. Typically I would reccomend this as a family place, but it was alright. The rooms were clean and they had an old-fashioned appeal. The front-desk service was kind of rude but other than that the hotel is in a good location and very convienent.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were evicted from our room at 3 am on a Saturday night on Memorial Day weekend. Their only reason given was "there were too many people going in and out of our room." There were six girls staying there! We were extremely quiet and were not rowdy at all. Come on! Who throws out a group of young ladies at 3am on Memorial Day weekend. Have you ever tried to find another hotel at that hour and that weekend? I don't even want to give them one star, but I don't have any other choice. I have nothing good to say about Phillips, and will never give them another cent of my money! Don't stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Phillips July 12 & 13, 2004. I was very pleased with the hotel, staff and location. I am planning another weekend get away at Phillips. I would certainly recommend Phillips to anyone interested in visiting Ocean City!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just finished my stay at the Beach Plaza Hotel (6/04) and must say I was not impressed. The wait staff and front desk staff was great. If you eat at the cafe, make sure the bartender is not your waitress, she is extremely miserable. Anyway, I was not pleased with the rooms. I opened a drawer and the face of it came off and on another drawer, the handles were hanging off. I also had dirty sheets and the shower was never cleaned from our day before. I think it is overpriced, no matter what the package is.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Eat, but Not a Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Phillips has a great restaurant. I think it is about the the best place to eat on the boardwalk. However, the hotel rooms are old and dingy. I would not recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While the hotel did have "charm" there were just too many negatives encountered on our recent stay.We were particularly distressed with the late night(2-3am)noise level at the front of the building and did not get much sleep. Also, the front porch was "taken over" around 1130pm on 2 of the 3 nites by a group of foulmouthed,chain smoking early 20 somethings who were staying in the Phillip's apartments adjacent to the hotel.Their litter-beer cans, butts and bottles- was not yet cleaned up at 10 the next morning. Someone did complain to management.In addition, some of the front desk personnel were not exactly helpful, when they had "computer problems"both at check-in and check-out.The room was ok but should have been about 50$ less for what you got.We"ll pass on this place next time.

Reviews.Title: “great place to get away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here several years ago and the hotel is beautiful. The staff is very pleasant. I enjoyed sitting on the rocking chairs on the porch overlooking the ocean
